question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements about Dr. B. R. Ambedkar?
  1. He launched a periodical “Mook Nayak” to bring to light the humiliations suffered by the “untouchables”
  2. He started and led Mahad Satyagraha and attended all the three Round Table Conferences
  3. He founded the Bharatiya Bauddha Mahasabha
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: December 6, the death anniversary of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar, is celebrated as Mahaparinirvan Din in the country. <u>First statement is correct</u> because Dr BR Ambedkar \"brought out Marathi weekly whose title was “Mook Nayak” to bring to light the humiliations suffered by the “untouchables”. <u>Second statement is also correct</u> the Mahad Satyagraha started in Maharashtra in 1927 was one of the defining moments in Ambedkar political thought and action. <u>Third statement is also correct</u> because Dr. Ambedkar attended all the three Round Table Conferences in London and each time, forcefully projected his views in the interest of the \'untouchable\'. <u>Fourth statement is also correct</u> as in 1955; he founded the Bharatiya Bauddha Mahasabha, or the Buddhist Society of India. Later, Ambedkar converted to Buddhism on the Deekshabhoomi in Nagpur on October 14, 1956.
